section.name: Create a new portlet
section.p: The Lutece pages are composed of portlets. It is possible to define new types of portlet which will then be available for building pages and enrich with new features. The new portlets must be packaged with optional administrative features, in the form of Plugins [HOWTO - Les plugins].
This document intends to describe the main steps in order to create a new portlet. The modifications needed concern the entire application; java ,database, templates, xsl, jsp
We will refer the notation <type> to indicate the name of a new type of portlet.

section.name: The JAVA classes to be defined
section.p: The addition of a new portlet type implies the creation of three business class :Portlet.java, PortletHome.java, PortletDAO.java belonging to the fr.paris.lutece.portal.business.portlet and also a bean for web display : PortletJspBean.java belonging to the package fr.paris.lutece.plugins.<myplugin>.web.portlet which is described as the following :

subsection.name: <type>Portlet.java
subsection.p: It must derive from the abstract class : Portlet which itself implements the interface :XmlContent (package fr.paris.lutece.plugins.<myplugin>.business).
This inheritance imposes the <type>Portlet class to implement two methods :
Also, it inherits the accessors (getters and setters ) on the properties representing a portlet which are grouped in the Portlet class and in constants (tags), defined in the XmlContent interface.
Finally ,two more methods need update on the portlet :

subsection.name: <type>PortletHome.java
subsection.p: It must be derived from the abstract class :PortletHome which itself implements the interface : PortletHomeInterface.
It must thus implement the two methods :

ul.li: public InterfaceDAO getDAO() : returns the unique PortletDAO instance described below
public int getPortletTypeId() : reurns the identifier of a portlet type stored in the database

subsection.p: This class operates like a singleton; the method :

ul.li: public static PortletHome getInstance() is necessary to access the unique instance.

subsection.name: <type>PortletDAO.java
subsection.p: It must implement the interface InterfaceDAO.
It must implement the data access methods as described below :

li.code: public void insert( Portlet portlet ) throws AppException;
public void delete( int nPortletId ) throws AppException;
public void store( Portlet portlet ) throws AppException;
public Portlet load( int nPortletId ) throws AppException;

subsection.p: Apart these essential methods, the developer is free to add to this class any data access methods required to manage a new portlet.

subsection.name: <type>PortletJspBean.java
subsection.p: It must derive from the class : PortletJspBean which itself implements the PortletJspBeanInterface interface.
This implies implementing the following methods for managing the portlet forms :

ul.li: public String getCreate( HttpServletRequest request ); : Displays of the creation portlet form
public String doCreate( HttpServletRequest request ); : Processes the creation of the portlet
public String getModify( HttpServletRequest request ); : Displays of the modification form
public String doModify( HttpServletRequest request ); : Processes the portlet (must call to the update method of the class <type>Portlet)
public String getPropertiesPrefix(); : Returns the prefix of properties of the portlet defined in the configuration file : lutece.properties

subsection.p: These different methods are called by the JSPs responsible for the creation and modification on a portlet. They are described below :
Also, <type>PortletJspBean inherits various methods of PortletJspBean allowing it to fetch the properties of the forms to display.
Finally, this class can contain other methods for portlets requiring further processing (for example, the saving process of a file in a Download type : DownloadFilePortlet)

Please notice that the processing of the deletion of a portlet must not be managed by the developer because it is controlled by AdminJspBean which calls the delete method redefined in the <type>Portlet.
The processing is thus the same for all portlet types.

subsection.name: JSP
subsection.p:
The four important JSPs in the management of a new portlet are :
CreatePortlet<type>.jsp
DoCreatePortlet<type>.jsp
ModifyPortlet<type>.jsp
DoModifyPortlet<type>.jsp
They call to the <type>PortletJspBean described before :
These JSP must also handle authentification and administration.

p.strong: Example of JSP used for display : CreatePortlet<Type>.jsp

div.pre:
<%@ include file="../PluginAdminHeader.jsp" %>
<jsp:useBean id="<type>Portlet" scope="session" class="fr.paris.lutece.portal.web.portlet.Portlet<Type>JspBean" />
<jsp:useBean id="user" scope="session" class="fr.paris.lutece.portal.web.user.UserJspBean" />
<%
    if( user.check( "DEF_ADMIN" ) )
    {
    %>
        <%= <type>Portlet.getCreate( request ); >
    <%
    }
    else
    {
        response.sendRedirect( user.getUrlAccesRefuse() );
    }
%>
<%@ include file="../../AdminFooter.jsp" %>

p.strong: Example de JSP used for processing : DoCreatePortlet<Type>

div.pre:
<%@ include file="../PluginAdminHeader.jsp" %>
<jsp:useBean id="<type>Portlet" scope="session" class="mdp.portail.web.rubrique.Portlet<Type>JspBean" />
<jsp:useBean id="user" scope="session" class="mdp.portail.web.user.UserJspBean" />
<%
    if( user.check( "DEF_ADMIN" ) )
    {
         response.sendRedirect( <type>Portlet.doCreate( request ) );
    }
    else
    {
         response.sendRedirect( user.getAccessDeniedUrl() );
    }
%>
<%@ include file="../../AdminFooter.jsp" %>

subsection.name: XSL style sheets
subsection.p: Many style sheets are developed by the management of the display of a new portlet type.
A first category corresponds to the displaying of the portlet. By convention, name name is :
portlet_<type>_<suffixe>.xsl where <suffixe> specifies the style sheet (for example : portlet_html_no_title.xsl).

The second category is used to display in administration mode. Each style sheet from the first category must have a corresponding to a style sheet in administration. The style sheet is used for preview of the portlet in administration module. By convention, its name is :
portlet_<type>_<suffixe>_adm.xsl. It is a copy of portlet_<type>_<suffix>.xsl to which must be added buttons ‘Modify this portlet’, ‘Delete this portlet’.
All these style sheets must be stored in database from the administration interface (cf Database paragraph )

subsection.name: HTML Templates
subsection.p: The HTML forms of a new portlet and its modification are seperated files :

ul.li: create_portlet.html et modify_portlet.html : contains corresponding common code for data entry forms and portlets modification.

Portlet's own templates correponds to data entry forms by adding corresponding to fields and javascripts.
These templates must be added to each new portlet in the folder : WEB-INF/templates/admin/plugins/<type>/et must be specified in the plugin's properties file:

tr.td: Title of the form for adding portlet of type <type>
Url of the jsp which manages addtion of a portlet of type <type>
Javascript used in the form to add portlet of type <type>.
The name of the template which contains specific code for portlet of type <type>
Name of file template which contains code from another form to add next to the existing one, used to create a portlet of type <type>..
Title of portlet type modification form <type>
Url of a jsp which handles update of a portlet type <type>
Specific javascript used by the update form of portlet type <type>.
Template which contains specific code specific to the portlet type <type>
Name of file template which contains code from another form to add next to the existing one, used to modify a portlet of type <type>..

subsection.p: Only the properties : portlet.<type>.create.title, portlet.<type>.create.url, portlet.<type>.modify.title and portlet.<type>.modify.url are mandatory.
Nevertherless, the javascript Submit() method must be defined as it is required for form validation.
To achieve this, the developer can proceed as follows :
-use the standards respected by most portlets : script_create_portlet.html and script_modify_portlet.html (in the Web-inf/templates/admin/portlet/ folder )
- or define the method in the specific form (contrarily to HTML portlet).

subsection.name: Database
subsection.p: The modification in the database concerns 4 tables :
Table portlet_type :

tr.td: Portlet's type label(label that will be displayed in scrolling menus)
Url of the JSP which displays input form of the portlet
Url of the JSP which displays the update form of the portlet
Complete Name (package included) in the class <type>PortletHome of the new Portlet type

subsection.p: The data is initialised in the database during installation.
The configuration of the plugin will thus contain information in the form
Table style :
A style corresponding to the new portlet type must e defined. This is done by using Lutece administration : : Style Management.
Tables stylesheet and style_mode_stylesheet :

Administration interface of Lutece :XSL stylesheets management allows definition of new styles and to link them to those stored into the database. All the stylesheets developed according to paragraph : XSL stylesheets must be stored by using this interface.
